image.altText: A close-up photo of Richard Marles.

props.synopsis: Three groups within defence are set to be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

title.children: Government set to overhaul defence department amid delays, blowouts

image.altText: Dan Tehan

props.synopsis: Shadow Energy Minister Dan Tehan seizes on warnings about potential blackouts, arguing that it is an example of how the energy "transition is failing". Follow live.

title.children: Bowen has 'egg on face' after AEMO warning, Tehan says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Government set to unveil defence department overhaul
Watt says govt will work to ensure Australia has 'full and reliable' electricity supply
Murray Watt moves to assure Tasmanians forestry won't be impacted by new laws

image.altText: An aerial view of poweer station with two large smoke stacks.

props.synopsis: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

title.children: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says

image.altText: A fire truck sits arked next to a fence with smoke from a bushfire filling a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of homes in the Mid West city of Geraldton remain under threat from an out-of-control bushfire, with firefighters battling extremely hot, dry and windy conditions.

title.children: One home lost in Geraldton emergency bushfire, arson suspected

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The ASX has slipped marginally while the market operator grabbles with yet another IT problem. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX unable to publish company announcements for several hours

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Businesses now need to register to send branded texts
ASX issues ongoing, according to error message

image.altText: Man holding a mobile phone looking at a woman generic

props.synopsis: A new eSafety advisory warns Australians about technology-facilitated abuse and provides advice on how to protect themselves from it.

title.children: Smart cars used as 'weapons' by domestic violence abusers

image.altText: Landon Germanotta-Mills arrest

props.synopsis: Four Sydney men are charged as police allege the group distributed "ritualistic and satanic" child abuse material online.

title.children: Police bust alleged 'satanic' Sydney child abuse network

image.altText: An illustration of a car with a plume of pollution behind.

props.synopsis: New rules around NOx, the most deadly form of vehicle pollution, come into force today, as testing reveals which popular models are pumping out more than others.

title.children: Two cars, similar size, but one emits 17 times more of a deadly pollutant

image.altText: A box of Mounjaro, a drug used for treating type 2 diabetes, sitting on a counter

props.synopsis: The explosive rise of drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is shifting consumption patterns, health outcomes and pushing pharmaceutical giants into trillion-dollar valuations.

title.children: The Ozempic effect reshaping supermarkets and stock markets

image.altText: Back of the head of a senior man, gray hair looking at tv in his lounge, black screen on the tv.

props.synopsis: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

title.children: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air TV access and facing internet issues

image.altText: Maroubra Housing

props.synopsis: National home values rose 1 per cent in November, according to Cotality's monthly index, which was the third straight month of gains above 1 per cent. But the pace of growth did moderate as the prospect of rate cuts faded.

title.children: Smaller capitals outperform Sydney, Melbourne property price growth

image.altText: Max Verstappen talks to Oscar Piastri

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the F1 title suffered a hammer blow after McLaren's strategy error in Qatar, but there is still hope. Here's how the Aussie can upset the odds in Abu Dhabi's decider.

title.children: How Oscar Piastri can still win the F1 world title

image.altText: An underwater shot in a water-filled cave, with rocks formations

props.synopsis: A team of cave diving specialists will attempt to retrieve body of a Victorian man trapped in one of Australia's longest underwater caves.

title.children: Thai cave rescuer to help retrieve diver's body from 'maze-like' system in SA

image.altText: court sketch of accused truck driver Brett Michael Russell

props.synopsis: Brett Russell was towing two trailers with faulty brakes at high speed in September 2022 when he crashed into the back of a school bus in regional Victoria.

title.children: Truck driver who crashed into Victorian school bus jailed

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: A series of clues relating to allegedly violently threats against an Adelaide high school has been released in the hope it could help identify the perpetrator, three months after charges against a teenager were dropped.

title.children: Police hope spelling errors could identify school threat suspect

image.altText: A middle aged woman with curly grey hair in a brown jacket in a tv studio

props.synopsis: The early childhood education minister is refusing to say whether the federal government will establish an independent review of childcare standards.

title.children: Minister won't commit to independent review amid childcare sector scrutiny

image.altText: Four young girls smile while holding a brown Labrador dog on the grass.

props.synopsis: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

title.children: Meet Shiloh, the last dog on Christmas Island

image.altText: People wade through a flooded area of Colombo, Sri Lanka

props.synopsis: At least 212 people are dead and 218 are missing in Sri Lanka as floods, cyclones and torrential rain continue to affect millions of people across Asia.

title.children: Death toll tops 800 as intense storms hammer Asian countries

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu gestures while addressing reporters from behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally asked for a pardon from President Isaac Herzog relating to corruption charges against him.

title.children: Benjamin Netanyahu formally asks for pardon on corruption charges

image.altText: Hong Kong police officers move through a burnt out apartment.

props.synopsis: Thousands of people pay tribute to the victims of Hong Kong's deadliest fire in more than 75 years, as Beijing warns it will crack down on any "anti-China" protest in the wake of the blaze.

title.children: Beijing warns against using Hong Kong blaze to 'disrupt' city

image.altText: Rustem Umerov facing towards Marco Rubio at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Marco Rubio says he expects the talks between US and Ukrainian officials on Sunday about finding a peace deal with Russia to yield progress in ending the war.

title.children: Rubio says Ukraine peace talks productive but work remains

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV blesses a child while standing among a group in front of a plane.

props.synopsis: As Pope Leo visits Lebanon, many locals hope he will bring peace to the region, viewing the visit as a message of solidarity.

title.children: Lebanese hope pope's visit will dissuade Israel from further strikes

image.altText: A wide, white building with an Australian flag held above it.

props.synopsis: The team of a contractor that was the victim of a Russia-linked hack did not have the necessary security clearance when it received thousands of sensitive communications between politicians and parliamentary staff, in a mistake the department has now conceded.

title.children: Sensitive parliament communications handed to contractor without security clearance

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese with his wife, Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: It is hard to imagine a better end to the prime minister's year than this one, but realists in government know Labor can't continue to ride the wave.

title.children: Albanese and Labor are at their zenith. What a difference a year makes

image.altText: Southport light rail tracks at sunset generic tram 4

props.synopsis: With the population heading toward 1 million, the Gold Coast is being urged to overhaul its transport system or risk becoming defined by traffic.

title.children: Gold Coast urged to curb car dependence after light rail loss

image.altText: Macquarie Point render, Gate 1 night

props.synopsis: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

title.children: What to expect as decision day on Macquarie Point stadium finally arrives

image.altText: Salad harvester at work at sunrise.

props.synopsis: Australian salad grower Dicky Bill enters administration, putting 180 people out of work before Christmas.

title.children: Sudden shutdown of Australian salad grower puts 180 people out of work

image.altText: A seated Aboriginal woman holds a microphone and gestures with her free hand.

props.synopsis: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their globally read book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

title.children: Aboriginal healers seek to share power of 'open hands' with Western doctors

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps.

props.synopsis: As the social media ban comes into effect, experts are worried children and families will be left vulnerable to age verification scams. Here's why.

title.children: Social media ban leaves children vulnerable to phishing scams, experts say

image.altText: A newsreader with a digital mask over her face.

props.synopsis: With AI deepfakes causing confusion and harm online, the federal government tells tech developers that AI content should be clearly labelled, ahead of a National AI Plan due to be released.

title.children: Tech companies advised to label AI-generated content

image.altText: England cricket team walk out

props.synopsis: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

title.children: When England won an Ashes by 675 runs to crowd's 'horror and amazement'

image.altText: Sunrise on beach

props.synopsis: After a soaking November, this week could deliver a very brief reprieve from the storms and scorching heat.

title.children: Queensland to enjoy cooler, drier first days of summer — but not for long

image.altText: A car covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's temperature is not forecast to rise above 15C today, making it the coldest December 1 since 1996.

title.children: Victoria shivers through coldest start to summer in almost 30 years

image.altText: Dozens of wind turbines scattered across the horizon.

props.synopsis: As approvals for multi-billion-dollar projects land on agendas at country local government meetings, staff and elected representatives battle to ensure their communities are prepared to benefit.

title.children: Councils in wind farm information race as shift to renewables ramps up

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers holds up a Australia flag

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers becomes only the second Australian athlete to be honoured at the World Athletics Awards, while legendary broadcaster Bruce McAvaney is recognised for his contribution to the sport.

title.children: Olyslagers and broadcast legend McAvaney honoured at World Athletics Awards
